data.title: Use Perceval summary

comments_data.body:
While I was implementing this feature I had big problems trying to make it work with the system that resumes jobs that have failed. The main problem is **resuming** requires to use the old summary to rerun a job when it fails. It is complicated to keep all that data and it looks like an antipattern to me.

When we developed resuming feature we decided to integrate it inside of `execute_perceval_job` because it was the only place with enough information to resume a job.

Since Perceval implemented a retry system and it produces a summary with the status of the fetch process, this might no longer needed. The scheduler will be able to reschedule a new job if necessary.

We need to refactorize that code before continuing with this task.
Resuming was refactored. An upcoming PR will use Perceval's summary.

data.body:
Since Perceval incorporates a summary object with the result of a fetching process (see chaoss/grimoirelab-perceval/issues/529), Arthur doesn't need to generate this summary by its own.

`JobResult` and `PercevalJob` classes should be rewritten to add the information that comes from Perceval.

data.title: [jobs] Add human readable job identifier

comments_data.body:
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/26489997/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/26489997)

Coverage increased (+0.05%) to 85.468% when pulling **f7cdcfb0ad0ccb56a052984d4b30004af305389f on sduenas:human-readable-job-ids** into **b13b1763d0b63158962f0757232a1dd9e57ddd6c on chaoss:master**.

data.body:
This identifier is an integer that will be increased each time a task is re-scheduled. Take into account
this is not a unique identifier and it is valid for a fast identification of a job within a task.

It addresses the idea of issue #74.

data.title: Allow to run again a failed task

comments_data.body: When working on this I found the problem of what to do with the status of the failed task. What should we do when re-scheduling it in the case of `max_age` was set? Should we reset the counter so it will run again as many times as defined in `max_age`?
After talking and thinking about this, we'll keep it as simple as possible. This is to reset the counter and to allow to run the task the same number of times it was configured originally.

data.body:
When a task fails is impossible to reload it. So far, the only way to do that is to delete and add the task again. This is a problem since related information, like jobs history will be lost.

Arthur should provide a method to re-run these tasks, probably updating their configuration parameters.

data.title: Refactor resuming

comments_data.body:
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/26380242/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/26380242)

Coverage increased (+0.2%) to 85.189% when pulling **fce400cdde43088f67f1c1029e5fa3158b109759 on sduenas:refactor-resuming** into **ec055ec373c25e3a3f9a2d136b71123fb2bc99d9 on chaoss:master**.

data.body: This patch addresses the request described in #77 to refactor job resuming. The scheduler will be the one responsible of re-scheduling failed tasks.

data.title: Expose jobs to the REST API

comments_data.body:
@sduenas I submitted a PR with the functionality+tests (#82)

Please, check it when you have time.

comments addressed @sduenas!

Check it again when you can

data.body:
In order to add the feature of the job logs (#72) in Raistlin, we have to expose the jobs with a REST petition to the CherryPy server.

The petition to the server must return all the needed information of the job asked.

data.title: Failed tasks on 'create' queue are rescheduled into 'update'

comments_data.body:
I'm working on this issue.

AFAIK, the method behind this behaviour is in `scheduler.py` script and it is called `_determine_queue`.

After discussing with @sduenas, we agreed on defining a new queue for retries and move those tasks which failed based on the value from the parameter `task.num_failures`. This will be the new behaviour:
* If `task.num_failures` > 0, then the task will be sent to this new retries queue.
* If the task succeded, `task.num_failures`  will be reset to 0.
* Field `task.age` still will be incremented even if the task failed.

data.body: When a task fails inside the `create` queue it is re-scheduled into `update` queue. These tasks should be re-scheduled into `create`.

data.title: Fix return of the job when the job is "queued"

comments_data.body:
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/26826811/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/26826811)

Coverage increased (+0.05%) to 85.515% when pulling **c17a037be5fb60b2e2a5f56887a365242e1f8e7b on dlumbrer:fix_result** into **7c0ec65e14994dd50d3f773140e2d079f2a9a985 on chaoss:master**.

data.body:
In order to fix the bug described in #98, this PR adds the next functionality:

- In the scheduler, the job_number field now is saved in the metadata of the job.
- The server picks the job_number from the metadata instead of the result.

data.title: Add job_number to the tasks and task queries

comments_data.body:
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/26860972/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/26860972)

Coverage increased (+0.08%) to 85.592% when pulling **5355714bb503a3fb328d9f4e6b28b9e4ec016c8a on dlumbrer:return_job_number** into **0f679e8f7ffb8ac8ffb0b7b2101dfbdec04fbda1 on chaoss:master**.

> Due to `task.jobs` will store a dict others will use, I think we should add a `NamedTuple` object that will store this data. I also recommend to add a method `add_job` or `set_job` to encapsulate the call to `append`.
> 
> See this [link](https://docs.python.org/3/library/typing.html#typing.NamedTuple) for info about `NamedTuple` type.

Addressed, thanks

data.body:
Summarizing, the changes was to change the list of job_id strings that were included in the task object for a list of objects that each object includes the job_id field and the job_number (changes made in the scheduler).

Moreover, in the server, it has been needed a change in the task query, adding the field job_number field in the list of jobs that it returned.


Related to #104

data.title: [setup] Update dependencies

comments_data.body:
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/26472071/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/26472071)

Coverage remained the same at 85.421% when pulling **377d73d092574dbb3559ff39be2b3f3a3c47fcdb on valeriocos:update-dependencies** into **b13b1763d0b63158962f0757232a1dd9e57ddd6c on chaoss:master**.

data.body:
This PR relates to https://github.com/chaoss/grimoirelab-kingarthur/issues/90. It updates the following dependencies:
- python-dateutil>=2.8.0
- cherrypy>=17.4.2
- cheroot>=8.2.1

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

data.title: Update depedencies

comments_data.body: Sounds good but I'm afraid we cannot update to a later version of cherrypy without big changes. Anyway, let's consider it.

data.body:
Arthur relies on old dependencies (see below). Since we are putting effort on it, it would be good to update them to reduce the gap with the latest ones available.
```
redis==3.0.0 ---> latest 3.3.11
rq==1.0.0 ---> latest 1.3.1
cheroot==5.8.3 ---> latest 8.2.1
cherrypy>=8.1, <=11.0.0 ---> latest 18.3.0
```
